p: Response: We have now clarified in greater detail why retesting for HIV after a negative test is likely to be a distinct behavior from incentivizing HIV testing in general (see Introduction, lines 80-92). Motivation to retest for HIV after a negative test may be lower than testing for HIV in general, given studies that have shown perceptions that retesting is unnecessary (e.g. Orne-Gliemann, J., et al. (2016). "Community perceptions of repeat HIV-testing: experiences of the ANRS 12249 Treatment as Prevention trial in rural South Africa." AIDS care 28 Suppl 3: 14-23).
